Subject: Re: [sfraves] Halloweenie

------=_Part_34987_18194489.1192478849628
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Content-Disposition: inline

Honestly it doesn't sound that bad to me, I mean, have you guys ever been to
New Orleans for Mardi Gras? Basically the entire town is covered in piss
after that mess, and it happens every year, over the whole city, not just
one neighborhood.

On 10/15/07, filter.sf@gmail.com <filter.sf@gmail.com> wrote:
>
> Why don't the organizers get together and propose an alternative
> rather than waiting for a bureacracy to do it for them? The City
> shouldn't be expected to come up with innovative solutions. That's the
> job of the citizens.
>
> -SK
>
> On 10/15/07, Jim Cyr <surfpunk@well.com> wrote:
> >
> > I actually agree with you - the city's true failure in all this
> > is its failure to provide an alternative
> >
> > At 11:54 AM 10/15/2007, you wrote:
> > >A densely populated residential neighborhood with a reputation that
> > >pushes the buttons of a large chunk of American society is probably
> > >the worst place to have an drunken, rowdy, public, jam packed event.
> > >
> > >I'm not sure why anybody would advocate for maintaining this event in
> > >the Castro and not moving it to SOMA or around City Hall, or even
> > >South Beach, where the other fests take place. If it's so strongly
> > >linked to the Castro culture, have a low-key parade instead that lasts
> > >an hour or so and move the parties indoors.
> > >
> > >Seriously...it's dark, alcohol-fueled, and the majority of the
> > >participants are unidentifyable due to costuming and it's so densely
> > >packed that anything can happen.
> > >
> > >I went only once when I first moved here and was so bruised up from
> > >all the drunken yahoos that I've vowed never to go back. I also had my
> > >new car keyed but some drunken asshole.
> > >
> > > > 7)  Removing porta potties from the Castro for the evening will not
> > > > ensure that people are not FORCED to go to the bathroom in
> > > > Castro residents' yards, driveways, and front doors.
> > >
> > >That right there is the very reason anybody living in the Castro would
> > >probably argue for banning the event outright. If I owned property in
> > >the Castro, I'd set up a neighborhood watch to make sure nobody in a
> > >costume entered my street on that particular night.
> > >
> > >The only thing "forcing" public balast making, vandalism or any of the
> > >other behavior that typically happens around this event is disrespect
> > >for oneself and another's property, and the level of tolerance the
> > >neighborhood has shown in the past.
> > >
> > >-SK
> > >
> > >On 10/15/07, Jim Cyr <surfpunk@well.com> wrote:
> > > >
> > > > San Francisco may well be on the verge of a nightmare -
> > > > I don't wish it on the city - I just think the writing's on the
> wall.
> > > >
> > > > Most of you know that I was (unlike many of you) -
> > > > a huge supporter of Gavin Newsom when he ran for mayor.
> > > > For the most part, many citizens agree that he has done
> > > > a decent job as mayor - as evidenced by that fact that he has
> > > > NO REAL opposition in his run for reelection.
> > > > I believe this 'fact' has left him complacent and seemingly
> > > > WAY OUT OF TOUCH with "REALITY" and that a major
> > > > disaster for San Francisco is only 16 Days Away !!
> > > >
> > > > I truly believe that the following are verifiable "facts":
> > > >
> > > > 1)  Halloween, as a MAJOR holiday has continued to evolve
> > > > into a bigger and bigger occasion each year - this holiday shows
> > > > no sign of diminishing in public popularity.
> > > >
> > > > 2)  In many urban areas - especially San Francisco -
> > > > Halloween is NOT "just" a kid's holiday - it, in fact, is just
> > > > as important a holiday for 100s of thousands of adults.
> > > >
> > > > 3)  Like Christmas, New Year's Eve and the Fourth of July -
> > > > Halloween is one of those holidays that MUST be observed
> > > > on the proper date - just like there are lots of "Christmas"
> > > > parties in December - there is no deflecting people's attention
> > > > from the main event.  There may be lots of "Halloween"
> > > > parties on the weekend before the true date, and that may
> > > > be enough for a lot of people - but for MANY people -
> > > > Halloween is October 31st - period !
> > > >
> > > > 4)  People like "tradition".  For years, the tradition in San
> Francisco
> > > > was to celebrate Halloween along Polk Street - back when Polk Street
> > > > was the center of gay life in San Francisco - but for AT LEAST
> > > > the last 20 YEARS - the tradition has been to celebrate Halloween
> > > > in the Castro - where, as most residents and visitors alike know -
> > > > it can be Halloween 365 days a year.  Further complicating the
> problem -
> > > > no other city or area in the entire Bay Area is known for
> > > > Halloween night gatherings.
> > > >
> > > > 5)  In years, where Halloween falls on a weekend, large public
> > > > parties have drawn some of the crowd away from the Castro -
> > > > however, with Halloween occurring on a WEDNESDAY this year -
> > > > and with an absence of ANY large public parties ANYWHERE
> > > > in San Francisco - where exactly are people supposed to go ?
> > > > There is NOWHERE else - in the entire Bay Area - you can't
> > > > wish this away any more than you can bouga-bouga it away.
> > > >
> > > > 6)  Just because Mayor Newsom, his advisors, some (rightfully)
> > > > nervous public officials and the police decide to "cancel" Halloween
> > > > in the Castro - and OFFER NO ALTERNATIVE - does not mean
> > > > that people will stay home or out of San Francisco.
> > > >
> > > > 7)  Removing porta potties from the Castro for the evening will not
> > > > ensure that people are not FORCED to go to the bathroom in
> > > > Castro residents' yards, driveways, and front doors.
> > > >
> > > > 8)  Refusing to close the streets does not mean that the streets
> > > > will not HAVE to be closed - the city grudgingly admits this,
> thinking
> > > > that maybe a block or two of the Castro itself may have to be shut
> down.
> > > > Closing the MUNI station in the Castro will only contribute to MORE
> > > > traffic congestion in the city.
> > > >
> > > > 9)  Refusing to properly erect barricades and install metal
> detectors
> > > > at security check points will not reduce the presence of
> > > potentially dangers
> > > > costumes and accoutrements in the Castro - it will, in fact,
> INCREASE
> > > > the likelihood that someone will get hurt - this is entirely
> preventable -
> > > > and should someone get hurt - I think that a good lawyer will be
> able
> > > > to prove that the city was negligent in not preventing or minimizing
> > > > the possibility of serious injury (or worse).
> > > >
> > > > 10)  The City of San Francisco is planning to spend money on
> > > > an ad campaign telling people to "STAY AWAY" - and they are also
> > > > planning to spend money on 600 police officers with a zero tolerance
> > > > attitude towards those "under the influence".  Not smart.
> > > >
> > > > 11)  The FACT of the matter is that the police and public officials
> > > > ARE NEVER in charge of large public gatherings - it is STUPID
> > > > of them to think that they are - especially in San Francisco.
> > > > There are, in fact, hundreds of thousands of people in San Francisco
> > > > who are, in fact, VERY cool - even when "under the influence".
> > > > These random, unknown, unofficial people are the ones who CAN
> > > > and DO control the crowds at all large public gatherings in San
> Francisco.
> > > >
> > > > Need an example ? - 2 or 3 Drag Queens (Sisters of Perpetual
> Indulgence)
> > > > can control hundreds if not thousands of people - BETTER - than
> > > > 100 fully loaded policemen.
> > > >
> > > > 12)  OK - Nine people were shot in the Castro last year - not within
> > > > the official boundaries of the party, but nearby.  Does ANYONE
> > > > in their right mind, think that banning Halloween in the Castro is
> going
> > > > to keep "that element" away ?  No it is not.
> > > >
> > > > Does ANYONE think that by banning sound systems and any kind
> > > > of diversion or entertainment that the Castro will be "safer" ?
> > > > No it will not.
> > > >
> > > > Does ANYONE think that a largely increased police presence - that
> > > > is, in fact, LOOKING FOR TROUBLE (zero tolerance) - will make
> > > > the Castro safer for its residents and businesses ?  In fact, the
> absence
> > > > of diversions, the crowds and the police presence add up to a powder
> keg
> > > > of potential trouble.
> > > >
> > > > As I see it the purpose of public officials and the police is to
> create
> > > > an environment where businesses can FLOURISH and citizens
> > > > can gather, safely. (asking Castro
> > > > businesses, especially bars, to close down on one of their
> potentially
> > > > most lucrative evenings of the year is, in a word - STUPID.
> > > > Making the people coming to the Castro the enemy is - STUPID.
> > > >
> > > > The truth in the old saying - when life gives you lemons, make
> lemonade -
> > > > couldn't be more applicable here.  Many of us PERSONALLY know
> > > > people who could turn this whole thing around - even at this late
> hour.
> > > >
> > > > The CITY OF SAN FRANCISCO SHOULD
> > > >
> > > > 1)   Get at least 8 to 10 Sound Systems into the Castro for the
> evening.
> > > >
> > > > 2)   Have a publicly sanctioned 'kid event' (organized by Cliff's)
> > > >       happening at 5 in the afternoon.
> > > >
> > > > 3)   Get a couple of hundred (at least) porta potties on the scene.
> > > >
> > > > 4)  Effectively "seal off" Castro by 6 in the afternoon - require
> EVERYONE
> > > > entering the area to pass through metal detectors - have your
> > > police presence
> > > > at the barricades on standby - ready to assist - not ready to
> confront.
> > > >
> > > > 5)  Get some pieces of 'oh,wow' Burning Man art on display for the
> evening.
> > > > Get a couple of major burn platforms in place - people love
> bonfires.
> > > >
> > > > 6)  Ask for help - from Anon Salon, from  SFRaves, from The Sisters,
> from
> > > > Tranny Shack, from Burners,  from Hippies, from Freaks - there are
> hundreds
> > > > of organized and disorganized social and arts groups that could at
> the drop
> > > > of a hat SHOW UP IN FORCE - all amazingly well costumed looking to
> dance,
> > > > to look and be looked at - NONE OF THEM LOOKING FOR TROUBLE.
> > > >
> > > > All of this (and more) could be accomplished in 15 Days - and the
> resultant
> > > > good vibes could save the city a lot of hassles that seem inevitable
> if the
> > > > current "denial and confrontation" attitude coming from city hall
> > > continues.
> > > >
> > > > Gavin, get a clue - if the current drift on Halloween in the Castro
> > > > continues -
> > > > you WILL be held directly accountable - by the electorate !!
> > > >
> > > >
> > > >

> > > >
> > > >On 10/15/07, Jim Cyr <surfpunk@well.com> wrote:
> > > > >
> > > > > San Francisco may well be on the verge of a nightmare -
> > > > > I don't wish it on the city - I just think the writing's on the
> > wall.
> > > > >
> > > > > Most of you know that I was (unlike many of you) -
> > > > > a huge supporter of Gavin Newsom when he ran for mayor.
> > > > > For the most part, many citizens agree that he has done
> > > > > a decent job as mayor - as evidenced by that fact that he has
> > > > > NO REAL opposition in his run for reelection.
> > > > > I believe this 'fact' has left him complacent and seemingly
> > > > > WAY OUT OF TOUCH with "REALITY" and that a major
> > > > > disaster for San Francisco is only 16 Days Away !!
> > > > >
> > > > > I truly believe that the following are verifiable "facts":
> > > > >
> > > > > 1)  Halloween, as a MAJOR holiday has continued to evolve
> > > > > into a bigger and bigger occasion each year - this holiday shows
> > > > > no sign of diminishing in public popularity.
> > > > >
> > > > > 2)  In many urban areas - especially San Francisco -
> > > > > Halloween is NOT "just" a kid's holiday - it, in fact, is just
> > > > > as important a holiday for 100s of thousands of adults.
> > > > >
> > > > > 3)  Like Christmas, New Year's Eve and the Fourth of July -
> > > > > Halloween is one of those holidays that MUST be observed
> > > > > on the proper date - just like there are lots of "Christmas"
> > > > > parties in December - there is no deflecting people's attention
> > > > > from the main event.  There may be lots of "Halloween"
> > > > > parties on the weekend before the true date, and that may
> > > > > be enough for a lot of people - but for MANY people -
> > > > > Halloween is October 31st - period !
> > > > >
> > > > > 4)  People like "tradition".  For years, the tradition in San
> > Francisco
> > > > > was to celebrate Halloween along Polk Street - back when Polk Str=
eet
> > > > > was the center of gay life in San Francisco - but for AT LEAST
> > > > > the last 20 YEARS - the tradition has been to celebrate Halloween
> > > > > in the Castro - where, as most residents and visitors alike know =
-
> > > > > it can be Halloween 365 days a year.  Further complicating the
> > problem -
> > > > > no other city or area in the entire Bay Area is known for
> > > > > Halloween night gatherings.
> > > > >
> > > > > 5)  In years, where Halloween falls on a weekend, large public
> > > > > parties have drawn some of the crowd away from the Castro -
> > > > > however, with Halloween occurring on a WEDNESDAY this year -
> > > > > and with an absence of ANY large public parties ANYWHERE
> > > > > in San Francisco - where exactly are people supposed to go ?
> > > > > There is NOWHERE else - in the entire Bay Area - you can't
> > > > > wish this away any more than you can bouga-bouga it away.
> > > > >
> > > > > 6)  Just because Mayor Newsom, his advisors, some (rightfully)
> > > > > nervous public officials and the police decide to "cancel" Hallow=
een
> > > > > in the Castro - and OFFER NO ALTERNATIVE - does not mean
> > > > > that people will stay home or out of San Francisco.
> > > > >
> > > > > 7)  Removing porta potties from the Castro for the evening will n=
ot
> > > > > ensure that people are not FORCED to go to the bathroom in
> > > > > Castro residents' yards, driveways, and front doors.
> > > > >
> > > > > 8)  Refusing to close the streets does not mean that the streets
> > > > > will not HAVE to be closed - the city grudgingly admits this,
> > thinking
> > > > > that maybe a block or two of the Castro itself may have to be shu=
t
> > down.
> > > > > Closing the MUNI station in the Castro will only contribute to MO=
RE
> > > > > traffic congestion in the city.
> > > > >
> > > > > 9)  Refusing to properly erect barricades and install metal
> > detectors
> > > > > at security check points will not reduce the presence of
> > > > potentially dangers
> > > > > costumes and accoutrements in the Castro - it will, in fact,
> > INCREASE
> > > > > the likelihood that someone will get hurt - this is entirely
> > preventable -
> > > > > and should someone get hurt - I think that a good lawyer will be
> > able
> > > > > to prove that the city was negligent in not preventing or minimiz=
ing
> > > > > the possibility of serious injury (or worse).
> > > > >
> > > > > 10)  The City of San Francisco is planning to spend money on
> > > > > an ad campaign telling people to "STAY AWAY" - and they are also
> > > > > planning to spend money on 600 police officers with a zero tolera=
nce
> > > > > attitude towards those "under the influence".  Not smart.
> > > > >
> > > > > 11)  The FACT of the matter is that the police and public officia=
ls
> > > > > ARE NEVER in charge of large public gatherings - it is STUPID
> > > > > of them to think that they are - especially in San Francisco.
> > > > > There are, in fact, hundreds of thousands of people in San Franci=
sco
> > > > > who are, in fact, VERY cool - even when "under the influence".
> > > > > These random, unknown, unofficial people are the ones who CAN
> > > > > and DO control the crowds at all large public gatherings in San
> > Francisco.
> > > > >
> > > > > Need an example ? - 2 or 3 Drag Queens (Sisters of Perpetual
> > Indulgence)
> > > > > can control hundreds if not thousands of people - BETTER - than
> > > > > 100 fully loaded policemen.
> > > > >
> > > > > 12)  OK - Nine people were shot in the Castro last year - not wit=
hin
> > > > > the official boundaries of the party, but nearby.  Does ANYONE
> > > > > in their right mind, think that banning Halloween in the Castro i=
s
> > going
> > > > > to keep "that element" away ?  No it is not.
> > > > >
> > > > > Does ANYONE think that by banning sound systems and any kind
> > > > > of diversion or entertainment that the Castro will be "safer" ?
> > > > > No it will not.
> > > > >
> > > > > Does ANYONE think that a largely increased police presence - that
> > > > > is, in fact, LOOKING FOR TROUBLE (zero tolerance) - will make
> > > > > the Castro safer for its residents and businesses ?  In fact, the
> > absence
> > > > > of diversions, the crowds and the police presence add up to a pow=
der
> > keg
> > > > > of potential trouble.
> > > > >
> > > > > As I see it the purpose of public officials and the police is to
> > create
> > > > > an environment where businesses can FLOURISH and citizens
> > > > > can gather, safely. (asking Castro
> > > > > businesses, especially bars, to close down on one of their
> > potentially
> > > > > most lucrative evenings of the year is, in a word - STUPID.
> > > > > Making the people coming to the Castro the enemy is - STUPID.
> > > > >
> > > > > The truth in the old saying - when life gives you lemons, make
> > lemonade -
> > > > > couldn't be more applicable here.  Many of us PERSONALLY know
> > > > > people who could turn this whole thing around - even at this late
> > hour.
> > > > >
> > > > > The CITY OF SAN FRANCISCO SHOULD
> > > > >
> > > > > 1)  Get at least 8 to 10 Sound Systems into the Castro for the
> > evening.
> > > > >
> > > > > 2)  Have a publicly sanctioned 'kid event' (organized by Cliff's)
> > > > >      happening at 5 in the afternoon.
> > > > >
> > > > > 3)  Get a couple of hundred (at least) porta potties on the scene=
.
> > > > >
> > > > > 4)  Effectively "seal off" Castro by 6 in the afternoon - require
> > EVERYONE
> > > > > entering the area to pass through metal detectors - have your
> > > > police presence
> > > > > at the barricades on standby - ready to assist - not ready to
> > confront.
> > > > >
> > > > > 5)  Get some pieces of 'oh,wow' Burning Man art on display for th=
e
> > evening.
> > > > > Get a couple of major burn platforms in place - people love
> > bonfires.
> > > > >
> > > > > 6)  Ask for help - from Anon Salon, from  SFRaves, from The Siste=
rs,
> > from
> > > > > Tranny Shack, from Burners,  from Hippies, from Freaks - there ar=
e
> > hundreds
> > > > > of organized and disorganized social and arts groups that could a=
t
> > the drop
> > > > > of a hat SHOW UP IN FORCE - all amazingly well costumed looking t=
o
> > dance,
> > > > > to look and be looked at - NONE OF THEM LOOKING FOR TROUBLE.
> > > > >
> > > > > All of this (and more) could be accomplished in 15 Days - and the
> > resultant
> > > > > good vibes could save the city a lot of hassles that seem inevita=

> > if the
> > > > > current "denial and confrontation" attitude coming from city hall
> > > > continues.
> > > > >
> > > > > Gavin, get a clue - if the current drift on Halloween in the Cast=

> > > > > continues -
> > > > > you WILL be held directly accountable - by the electorate !!

> On 10/15/07, filter.sf@gmail.com <filter.sf@gmail.com> wrote:

> > On 10/15/07, Jim Cyr <surfpunk@well.com> wrote:
> > >
> > > I actually agree with you - the city's true failure in all this
> > > is its failure to provide an alternative
> > >
> > > At 11:54 AM 10/15/2007, you wrote:
> > > >A densely populated residential neighborhood with a reputation that
> > > >pushes the buttons of a large chunk of American society is probably
> > > >the worst place to have an drunken, rowdy, public, jam packed event.
> > > >
> > > >I'm not sure why anybody would advocate for maintaining this event i=
n
> > > >the Castro and not moving it to SOMA or around City Hall, or even
> > > >South Beach, where the other fests take place. If it's so strongly
> > > >linked to the Castro culture, have a low-key parade instead that
> lasts
> > > >an hour or so and move the parties indoors.
> > > >
> > > >Seriously...it's dark, alcohol-fueled, and the majority of the
> > > >participants are unidentifyable due to costuming and it's so densely
> > > >packed that anything can happen.
> > > >
> > > >I went only once when I first moved here and was so bruised up from
> > > >all the drunken yahoos that I've vowed never to go back. I also had
> my
> > > >new car keyed but some drunken asshole.
> > > >
> > > > > 7)  Removing porta potties from the Castro for the evening will
> not
> > > > > ensure that people are not FORCED to go to the bathroom in
> > > > > Castro residents' yards, driveways, and front doors.
> > > >
> > > >That right there is the very reason anybody living in the Castro
> would
> > > >probably argue for banning the event outright. If I owned property i=
n
> > > >the Castro, I'd set up a neighborhood watch to make sure nobody in a
> > > >costume entered my street on that particular night.
> > > >
> > > >The only thing "forcing" public balast making, vandalism or any of
> the
> > > >other behavior that typically happens around this event is disrespec=
t
> > > >for oneself and another's property, and the level of tolerance the
> > > >neighborhood has shown in the past.
> > > >
> > > >-SK
> > > >
> > > >On 10/15/07, Jim Cyr <surfpunk@well.com> wrote:
> > > > >
> > > > > San Francisco may well be on the verge of a nightmare -
> > > > > I don't wish it on the city - I just think the writing's on the
> > wall.
> > > > >
> > > > > Most of you know that I was (unlike many of you) -
> > > > > a huge supporter of Gavin Newsom when he ran for mayor.
> > > > > For the most part, many citizens agree that he has done
> > > > > a decent job as mayor - as evidenced by that fact that he has
> > > > > NO REAL opposition in his run for reelection.
> > > > > I believe this 'fact' has left him complacent and seemingly
> > > > > WAY OUT OF TOUCH with "REALITY" and that a major
> > > > > disaster for San Francisco is only 16 Days Away !!
> > > > >
> > > > > I truly believe that the following are verifiable "facts":
> > > > >
> > > > > 1)  Halloween, as a MAJOR holiday has continued to evolve
> > > > > into a bigger and bigger occasion each year - this holiday shows
> > > > > no sign of diminishing in public popularity.
> > > > >
> > > > > 2)  In many urban areas - especially San Francisco -
> > > > > Halloween is NOT "just" a kid's holiday - it, in fact, is just
> > > > > as important a holiday for 100s of thousands of adults.
> > > > >
> > > > > 3)  Like Christmas, New Year's Eve and the Fourth of July -
> > > > > Halloween is one of those holidays that MUST be observed
> > > > > on the proper date - just like there are lots of "Christmas"
> > > > > parties in December - there is no deflecting people's attention
> > > > > from the main event.  There may be lots of "Halloween"
> > > > > parties on the weekend before the true date, and that may
> > > > > be enough for a lot of people - but for MANY people -
> > > > > Halloween is October 31st - period !
> > > > >
> > > > > 4)  People like "tradition".  For years, the tradition in San
> > Francisco
> > > > > was to celebrate Halloween along Polk Street - back when Polk
> Street
> > > > > was the center of gay life in San Francisco - but for AT LEAST
> > > > > the last 20 YEARS - the tradition has been to celebrate Halloween
> > > > > in the Castro - where, as most residents and visitors alike know =
-
> > > > > it can be Halloween 365 days a year.  Further complicating the
> > problem -
> > > > > no other city or area in the entire Bay Area is known for
> > > > > Halloween night gatherings.
> > > > >
> > > > > 5)  In years, where Halloween falls on a weekend, large public
> > > > > parties have drawn some of the crowd away from the Castro -
> > > > > however, with Halloween occurring on a WEDNESDAY this year -
> > > > > and with an absence of ANY large public parties ANYWHERE
> > > > > in San Francisco - where exactly are people supposed to go ?
> > > > > There is NOWHERE else - in the entire Bay Area - you can't
> > > > > wish this away any more than you can bouga-bouga it away.
> > > > >
> > > > > 6)  Just because Mayor Newsom, his advisors, some (rightfully)
> > > > > nervous public officials and the police decide to "cancel"
> Halloween
> > > > > in the Castro - and OFFER NO ALTERNATIVE - does not mean
> > > > > that people will stay home or out of San Francisco.
> > > > >
> > > > > 7)  Removing porta potties from the Castro for the evening will
> not
> > > > > ensure that people are not FORCED to go to the bathroom in
> > > > > Castro residents' yards, driveways, and front doors.
> > > > >
> > > > > 8)  Refusing to close the streets does not mean that the streets
> > > > > will not HAVE to be closed - the city grudgingly admits this,
> > thinking
> > > > > that maybe a block or two of the Castro itself may have to be shu=
t
> > down.
> > > > > Closing the MUNI station in the Castro will only contribute to
> MORE
> > > > > traffic congestion in the city.
> > > > >
> > > > > 9)  Refusing to properly erect barricades and install metal
> > detectors
> > > > > at security check points will not reduce the presence of
> > > > potentially dangers
> > > > > costumes and accoutrements in the Castro - it will, in fact,
> > INCREASE
> > > > > the likelihood that someone will get hurt - this is entirely
> > preventable -
> > > > > and should someone get hurt - I think that a good lawyer will be
> > able
> > > > > to prove that the city was negligent in not preventing or
> minimizing
> > > > > the possibility of serious injury (or worse).
> > > > >
> > > > > 10)  The City of San Francisco is planning to spend money on
> > > > > an ad campaign telling people to "STAY AWAY" - and they are also
> > > > > planning to spend money on 600 police officers with a zero
> tolerance
> > > > > attitude towards those "under the influence".  Not smart.
> > > > >
> > > > > 11)  The FACT of the matter is that the police and public
> officials
> > > > > ARE NEVER in charge of large public gatherings - it is STUPID
> > > > > of them to think that they are - especially in San Francisco.
> > > > > There are, in fact, hundreds of thousands of people in San
> Francisco
> > > > > who are, in fact, VERY cool - even when "under the influence".
> > > > > These random, unknown, unofficial people are the ones who CAN
> > > > > and DO control the crowds at all large public gatherings in San
> > Francisco.
> > > > >
> > > > > Need an example ? - 2 or 3 Drag Queens (Sisters of Perpetual
> > Indulgence)
> > > > > can control hundreds if not thousands of people - BETTER - than
> > > > > 100 fully loaded policemen.
> > > > >
> > > > > 12)  OK - Nine people were shot in the Castro last year - not
> within
> > > > > the official boundaries of the party, but nearby.  Does ANYONE
> > > > > in their right mind, think that banning Halloween in the Castro i=
s
> > going
> > > > > to keep "that element" away ?  No it is not.
> > > > >
> > > > > Does ANYONE think that by banning sound systems and any kind
> > > > > of diversion or entertainment that the Castro will be "safer" ?
> > > > > No it will not.
> > > > >
> > > > > Does ANYONE think that a largely increased police presence - that
> > > > > is, in fact, LOOKING FOR TROUBLE (zero tolerance) - will make
> > > > > the Castro safer for its residents and businesses ?  In fact, the
> > absence
> > > > > of diversions, the crowds and the police presence add up to a
> powder
> > keg
> > > > > of potential trouble.
> > > > >
> > > > > As I see it the purpose of public officials and the police is to
> > create
> > > > > an environment where businesses can FLOURISH and citizens
> > > > > can gather, safely. (asking Castro
> > > > > businesses, especially bars, to close down on one of their
> > potentially
> > > > > most lucrative evenings of the year is, in a word - STUPID.
> > > > > Making the people coming to the Castro the enemy is - STUPID.
> > > > >
> > > > > The truth in the old saying - when life gives you lemons, make
> > lemonade -
> > > > > couldn't be more applicable here.  Many of us PERSONALLY know
> > > > > people who could turn this whole thing around - even at this late
> > hour.
> > > > >
> > > > > The CITY OF SAN FRANCISCO SHOULD
> > > > >
> > > > > 1)  Get at least 8 to 10 Sound Systems into the Castro for the
> > evening.
> > > > >
> > > > > 2)  Have a publicly sanctioned 'kid event' (organized by Cliff's)
> > > > >      happening at 5 in the afternoon.
> > > > >
> > > > > 3)  Get a couple of hundred (at least) porta potties on the scene=
.
> > > > >
> > > > > 4)  Effectively "seal off" Castro by 6 in the afternoon - require
> > EVERYONE
> > > > > entering the area to pass through metal detectors - have your
> > > > police presence
> > > > > at the barricades on standby - ready to assist - not ready to
> > confront.
> > > > >
> > > > > 5)  Get some pieces of 'oh,wow' Burning Man art on display for th=
e
> > evening.
> > > > > Get a couple of major burn platforms in place - people love
> > bonfires.
> > > > >
> > > > > 6)  Ask for help - from Anon Salon, from  SFRaves, from The
> Sisters,
> > from
> > > > > Tranny Shack, from Burners,  from Hippies, from Freaks - there ar=
e
> > hundreds
> > > > > of organized and disorganized social and arts groups that could a=
t
> > the drop
> > > > > of a hat SHOW UP IN FORCE - all amazingly well costumed looking t=
o
> > dance,
> > > > > to look and be looked at - NONE OF THEM LOOKING FOR TROUBLE.
> > > > >
> > > > > All of this (and more) could be accomplished in 15 Days - and the
> > resultant
> > > > > good vibes could save the city a lot of hassles that seem
> inevitable
> > if the
> > > > > current "denial and confrontation" attitude coming from city hall
> > > > continues.
> > > > >
> > > > > Gavin, get a clue - if the current drift on Halloween in the
> Castro
> > > > > continues -
> > > > > you WILL be held directly accountable - by the electorate !!
> > > > >
> > > > >

> > > > > >
> > > > > > 8)  Refusing to close the streets does not mean that the street=
s
> > > > > > will not HAVE to be closed - the city grudgingly admits this,
> > > thinking
> > > > > > that maybe a block or two of the Castro itself may have to be
> shut
> > > down.
> > > > > > Closing the MUNI station in the Castro will only contribute to
> MORE
> > > > > > traffic congestion in the city.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > 9)  Refusing to properly erect barricades and install metal
> > > detectors
> > > > > > at security check points will not reduce the presence of
> > > > > potentially dangers
> > > > > > costumes and accoutrements in the Castro - it will, in fact,
> > > INCREASE
> > > > > > the likelihood that someone will get hurt - this is entirely
> > > preventable -
> > > > > > and should someone get hurt - I think that a good lawyer will b=
e
> > > able
> > > > > > to prove that the city was negligent in not preventing or
> minimizing
> > > > > > the possibility of serious injury (or worse).
> > > > > >
> > > > > > 10)  The City of San Francisco is planning to spend money on
> > > > > > an ad campaign telling people to "STAY AWAY" - and they are als=
o
> > > > > > planning to spend money on 600 police officers with a zero
> tolerance
> > > > > > attitude towards those "under the influence".  Not smart.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > 11)  The FACT of the matter is that the police and public
> officials
> > > > > > ARE NEVER in charge of large public gatherings - it is STUPID
> > > > > > of them to think that they are - especially in San Francisco.
> > > > > > There are, in fact, hundreds of thousands of people in San
> Francisco
> > > > > > who are, in fact, VERY cool - even when "under the influence".
> > > > > > These random, unknown, unofficial people are the ones who CAN
> > > > > > and DO control the crowds at all large public gatherings in San
> > > Francisco.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > Need an example ? - 2 or 3 Drag Queens (Sisters of Perpetual
> > > Indulgence)
> > > > > > can control hundreds if not thousands of people - BETTER - than
> > > > > > 100 fully loaded policemen.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > 12)  OK - Nine people were shot in the Castro last year - not
> within
> > > > > > the official boundaries of the party, but nearby.  Does ANYONE
> > > > > > in their right mind, think that banning Halloween in the Castro
> is
> > > going
> > > > > > to keep "that element" away ?  No it is not.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > Does ANYONE think that by banning sound systems and any kind
> > > > > > of diversion or entertainment that the Castro will be "safer" ?
> > > > > > No it will not.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > Does ANYONE think that a largely increased police presence -
> that
> > > > > > is, in fact, LOOKING FOR TROUBLE (zero tolerance) - will make
> > > > > > the Castro safer for its residents and businesses ?  In fact,
> the
> > > absence
> > > > > > of diversions, the crowds and the police presence add up to a
> powder
> > > keg
> > > > > > of potential trouble.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > As I see it the purpose of public officials and the police is t=
o
> > > create
> > > > > > an environment where businesses can FLOURISH and citizens
> > > > > > can gather, safely. (asking Castro
> > > > > > businesses, especially bars, to close down on one of their
> > > potentially
> > > > > > most lucrative evenings of the year is, in a word - STUPID.
> > > > > > Making the people coming to the Castro the enemy is - STUPID.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > The truth in the old saying - when life gives you lemons, make
> > > lemonade -
> > > > > > couldn't be more applicable here.  Many of us PERSONALLY know
> > > > > > people who could turn this whole thing around - even at this
> late
> > > hour.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > The CITY OF SAN FRANCISCO SHOULD
> > > > > >
> > > > > > 1)  Get at least 8 to 10 Sound Systems into the Castro for the
> > > evening.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > 2)  Have a publicly sanctioned 'kid event' (organized by
> Cliff's)
> > > > > >      happening at 5 in the afternoon.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > 3)  Get a couple of hundred (at least) porta potties on the
> scene.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > 4)  Effectively "seal off" Castro by 6 in the afternoon -
> require
> > > EVERYONE
> > > > > > entering the area to pass through metal detectors - have your
> > > > > police presence
> > > > > > at the barricades on standby - ready to assist - not ready to
> > > confront.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > 5)  Get some pieces of 'oh,wow' Burning Man art on display for
> the
> > > evening.
> > > > > > Get a couple of major burn platforms in place - people love
> > > bonfires.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > 6)  Ask for help - from Anon Salon, from  SFRaves, from The
> Sisters,
> > > from
> > > > > > Tranny Shack, from Burners,  from Hippies, from Freaks - there
> are
> > > hundreds
> > > > > > of organized and disorganized social and arts groups that could
> at
> > > the drop
> > > > > > of a hat SHOW UP IN FORCE - all amazingly well costumed looking
> to
> > > dance,
> > > > > > to look and be looked at - NONE OF THEM LOOKING FOR TROUBLE.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > All of this (and more) could be accomplished in 15 Days - and
> the
> > > resultant
> > > > > > good vibes could save the city a lot of hassles that seem
> inevitable
> > > if the
> > > > > > current "denial and confrontation" attitude coming from city
> hall
> > > > > continues.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > Gavin, get a clue - if the current drift on Halloween in the
> Castro
> > > > > > continues -
> > > > > > you WILL be held directly accountable - by the electorate !!
> > > > > >

From sfraves-return-142311-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org Tue Oct 16 01:27:19 2007

Message-ID: <47141391.5080306@egregious.net>
Date: Mon, 15 Oct 2007 18:27:45 -0700
From: Catharsis <catharsis@egregious.net>
User-Agent: Thunderbird 2.0.0.6 (Windows/20070728)

X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] Fractured w/ Robert Natus & ArkusP Live Battle PA 10.17.07

Greets,

Well.. I've kind of been around here for a while ('98 to '06), but left 
over the last year...  Just a note.. This is the last EDM event I'm 
promoting unless magically I can get a crew together. Since there isn't 
a scene (let alone an industry) for techno (outside of the most adult 
contemporary minimal variety / and thats still just a scene!) in the US 
I'm giving up the fight. I'm happy with what I accomplished. Over the 
past couple of years I hosted some really neat UGs that were focused on 
moving into a new territory. For me this is advanced spatial audio for 
2D and 3D arrays. I wished I could have invited everyone to these 
events, but with this final event I'm doing it at a public venue. I'm 
not giving up music.. In fact I've started an audio hardware company 
called Periphony Systems (www.periphonysystems.com / new web site soon!) 
and am focusing fully on the tech angle as that seems the only way one 
can create a professional career in the US outside of pandering to the 
masses.. Nonetheless.. I hope some of you can make it out for this final 
event. I know there are several techno heads here that never have made 
it out to any of my events.. Well this is possibly your last chance.. :) 
I'm quite glad with the lineup, so come check it out..

Best,
--Mike

---------------------------------------

EGR Records invites you to Fractured on Wednesday October 17th, 2007 at 
the DNA Lounge in San Francisco.

I'm pleased to be working with two talented and well known international 
producers from Germany, Robert Natus (Abstract/Bitshift) and Arkus P 
(Abstract). I've been playing their music for the last 5 years and it 
will be a treat to have them perform in SF. In support will be myself 
(Catharsis), Mochipet (Daly City Records), DJ Intoner (Death Guild), 
Mitch (Death Guild), and Bloody Snowman (Daly City Records). This event 
will be a full night of quality music covering industrial-techno, 
breakcore, powernoise, and IDM.

This will be the last EGR event for quite some time, so come out and 
enjoy it and make this one to remember!

Where: DNA Lounge; 375 11th St. San Francisco CA
When: 10/17/07; SF 9:30pm to 2am
Cost: $7 @ door before 11pm; $10 afterwards
http://www.egregious.net/events/2007/fractured/

***If you would like to sign up for the EGR announcement email list 
(very low volume) and get a discount on entry send an email to 
katharsis7@yahoo.com w/ EGR List Entry in the title. This will give you 
a $5 ticket before 10pm, but if you are in line outside the venue before 
9:30pm (opening) you will get in for free (cut off immediately at 
9:30pm). If you're on a budget this is quite a deal for the lineup 
presented at Fractured!***

Check out an older live battle PA from Robert Natus & Arkus P to get an 
idea of their music if you are not familiar!
http://www.ngoht.hu/dl2/archive/20041225/robert_natus_&_arkus_p._liveact_@_kashmir_20041225_%2802.20-04.00%29.mp3

Lineup (Main Room):
9:30pm to 11:00pm     Catharsis (EGR Records; SF)  on 3 decks!
11:00pm to 2:00am     Robert Natus vs Arkus P Live Battle PA (Abstract; 
Hamburg/Frankfurt Germany)

Upstairs Room (breakcore/powernoise/IDM)
Time     Performer
9:30pm to 10:30pm     DJ Intoner (Death Guild; Oakland)
10:30pm to 11:30pm     Bloody Snowman (Daly City Records)
11:30pm to 12:00am     DJ Intoner (Death Guild; Oakland)
12:00am to 1:00am     Mochipet (Daly City Records; SF)
1:00am to 2:00am     Mitch (Death Guild; SF)

Go-go dancing by poor impulse control..

Myspace and more info on the artists:
Robert Natus -- http://www.myspace.com/robertnatus
ArkusP -- http://www.myspace.com/arkusp
Catharsis -- http://www.myspace.com/egrrecords
Mochipet -- http://www.myspace.com/mochipet
Bloody Snowman -- http://www.myspace.com/bloodysnowman
DJ Intoner -- http://www.myspace.com/intoner

-- 
Egregious
"Renewal through music for those outside the heard."
http://www.egregious.net/

Try the Transbsy terminal on the day of the first good rain of the year.

You've got six months of bum funk, crackhead piss, and junkie poo  
that's been accumulating in the shrubbery and all the little nooks  
and crannies.  When the rains come, it all re-hydrates at once, and  
the whole place stinks like raw sewage.

I bet if those nitwits at the Guardian who think the city shouldn't  
be prosecuting "quality of life" crimes had to go through the  
terminal every day to get to and from work, they'd be singing a  
different tune.

Subject: [sfraves] WR: Sac to Berk: my weekend raver gypsy weekend

So Saturday i was "needed" up in Sac... :code TV was suppose to cover this
relaunch/ 3 yr anniversary shindig for LEGENDmag.  So i wnet up there w/
Roni & KC & oooh shit man... ok.. the spot was this store front building
on 20th & something & the kinda space there was like for 3 stores w/ no
walls yet.. so it was huge!!!  Set up was kinda laggin', but no really
decorations, just a few banners that had some LEGENDmag articles on them. 
But then there was also a redbull/ vodka bar (they were 1 of the
sponsers), a DJ booth/ dance floor, like 6 or 7 indy clothing vendors, a
photo area where this photographer dude like took pictures of random
people, & a make up artist who lol, powdered me when i was sweaty & we had
to shoot a segment, oh oh oh, & there was this movie Dude who showed his
films on this projector all night!  The shindig started @ 6, but the
action didn't start 'til around like 7:30ish...

There's this thing in Downtown SAc called 2nd Saturdays.. it's like this
mondo party every second Sat of the summer months... so as soon as evening
hit.. there were hordes of people walking around to the near by bars &
clubs... oh yeah.. there was even a DJ spinning outta store in the same
building on the opposite side of where we were!!

So pretty much there was alot goin' @ the mag shindig... all the clothes i
saw were so damn yummy!!  But hmmm... they wre kinda expensive... oh
yeah... so like every interview we did, we like totally had to shoot twice
cause the Editor, Rai-mon, wanted to make a show for the website too!  So
anywaze.. it was kinda funny.. i ended up like interviewing the
photographer dude & he like like took hella pictures of me during the
interveiw... it was funny... i mean... & add to that the 2 other phot
shoots i did with him when before we interviewed him... that was funny!

But yeah.. hella people showed up & I met sooo many Groovy people!!  The
break dancers were fuckin' ill!  There was this Chic dance group that i
missed thought :(  I think i was outside takin' a break & cooling out
''cause it got totally mondo hot in the party with all them super duper
power lamps.

All in all.. Hello 2Day, i had such a Groovy Awesome time! It was fuckin'
So Dope too 'cause i ended up seeing a few Sac homies :)  I wish i coulda
called more of the Sac Familia.. but i had no #'s :(  Oh oh oh oh ohoh...
the DJs were dope... the 1st DJ played this old skool hop set, the 2nd DJ
spun like hella booty retro clubby 80's 90's music & he dropped Ghetto
Tech!!!  YUM!!  I don't really like remember what the 3rd DJ spun 'cause
me & Roni wanted to catch more interviews before the party wrapped up...

I'll probably write another post about the mag & tell y'all what it's all
about... I think the website's up too & link y'all to that :)

Around like 12:30ish...  after everything was cleaned up as much as
possible & stuff put away, we cut, tired as fuck & kinda burnt from the
night... I was suppose to go to this surprise birthday party in Berk for
my Homie Al.. but i was just so like burnt from well.. i didn't get that
much sleep the night before which i guess added to the hustle & bustle of
the day...

But after we crossed the Carquinez bridge... lol.. i seriously got like
this mondo second wind & said fuck it... i need to go to Berk.. so i did
'cause i didn't wanna be all guilty for missing my Bro's bday!  OK.. lemme
just say that 16 hours later... I was @ another house for a mini party,
then after that.. took BART home ;)  HELLO 2DAY!!!  Yeah.. ok.. partied in
true Rockstar fashion, got so happy to around mi rave familia, danced,
laughed, almost played ummmm around, talked, oh oh oh oh, ok so like me &
this dude who i've always been like on well.. he always hated me fr some
reason, well, I've always called him Mikey Meanie Gay 'cause he was always
like this snob to me when we wre at the same place... but yeah... we
heeeeeeeeella talked it out & like totally made up & fuck man.. it just
felt so good to air out that mondo dirty laundry!!  So YAY!!!

Yeah... I left my house @ 2PM Saturday & got home @ 9:30PMish on Sunday!! 
So Dope!!  Hello 2day... it took me all day to get unhungover!!
-- 
Take Care <3
Peace=->Jus' Me =-> ObY {8O)

From: filter.sf@gmail.com
To: SFR <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Content-Disposition: inline
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] [BSP] Oct.26 :: 180 minutes of Butane :: 60 minutes with Kontakt

Friday October 26: Filter at Anu is pleased to host the return of ::::

B U T A N E (Alphahouse/Berlin) with a 3 hour Dj set.

Plus BABD + Filter founder Kontakt with a Live PA premier.

Anu-bar
46 Sixth Street, SF
$5 before 11:00 PM
$10 after 11:00


If you were at the Detroit Electronic Music Festival this year,
Butane's two, count em, two memorable performances placed his name on
the lips of many minimal house and techno fans.

Now based in Berlin, Butane - who founded the Alphahouse party and
label - has managed to solidify his already infamous reputation as a
captivating performer. He's one who knows well that "minimal" is
merely a philosophy to be applied, rather than a narrow range of
sounds.

If you missed him last time we brought him to S.F on that rainy
February night, you'll know where to go Friday, October 26.

Get to Anu early to catch a three hour DJ set, plus a Live PA premier
of new + soon to be released material by Filter's Kontakt.

Kontakt grew up at the onset of Montreal's post-punk milleux, sharing
the love of initial imports from the likes of Gary Neuman and Joy
Division before the "The Unknown Pleasures" album art became staple
dorm room decor.

No fan of disco, or the early house music that followed, Kontakt
avoided the decade of dance music's rise and fall, to embrace its
eventual rebirth in the form of beat-centric minimalism, ambiant,
experimental and techno.

Two years after picking up his first set of turntables only to toss em
in favor of embracing the digital evolution, we bring you Kontakt's
debut Live PA set.

Hours of exposure to early U.K. post-punk made it's imprint. If
Ritchie Hawtin had been born a decade earlier in Manchester and had
Ian Curtis had listened to Kraftwerk rather than Iggy Pop...then,
well....we might have had.......

never mind.

Just get drunk with us, enjoy the show and show us some wigglin'!

////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

Info, bio, tracks:

www.myspace.com/butane_alphahouse
www.myspace.com/filtersf

///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

Coming up: Filter at Anu

November 30: David Last -Live PA [Goosehound, Foundsound, Wolf + Lamb
Music, Musique Risquee/Brooklyn]

December 28: Fanon Flowers - Live PA [Nheoma, Numb, Mechanism
Industries/ LA,Detroit]


-- 

www.myspace.com/filtersf

Subject: [sfraves] BSP: Pt. 2 of the 14 yr. anniversary for An Epiphany Of Sound Thur.

So, I'm extending the celebration of 14 yrs. of An Epiphany Of Sound 
this Thursday by bringing in local techno musician Chel-C Faith for a 
live P.A.  She'll be working from a table full of gear, live from the 
KZSU Studios (if you want to look in, be sure to go to 
http://studio.stanford.edu) beginning at 10a.  I'll be filling the 
9a-10a gap with a techno mix too.  Mmmm techno!

As usual, the show is from 9a-noon Thur. on 90.1 FM in the bay area, and 
online at http://kzsulive.stanford.edu

Hope you tune in and help me celebrate!

4 Jesus" banner.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Acid Totem Reviews?

--0-7344197-1192734365=:98460
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

honestly... it was fucking sweet! i wasn't quite sure what to expect, but this party turned out to be the greatest close to the campout season i could have hoped for. the scenery was incredible, my crew got some really reckless mountain biking in, the music was kickass the entire time (except for one set on saturday night - wtf, who still plays "the launch"?!) and it never stopped! 

maybe i'm getting old, but i'm kind of done with campouts that are basically a bunch of kids on drugs. acid totem's crowd wasn't like that *at all*. it was really refreshing to be around a crowd that was all smiles and super positive without being all "can i give you a hug?" and trying to drink my water ;)

seriously, props to acid totem. i'd definitely go to this party again next year. the beauty of the location alone would seal the deal for me, but the rockin' tunes, excellent neighbors, and chilled out vibe make it completely awesome. 

thanks to all involved for helping me end the campout season on such a high note!

love,
mo


Bam <invibe@gmail.com> wrote: was unable to go, but would love to hear how it went!

well if it's any consolation, i think the booming bass kept the tarantulas a safe distance away. the one tarantula sighting that i heard of (and saw a picture of - holy shit!) was a fair hike away from the party spot. 

and dude, there was like 30 seconds of drizzle and the sound was for sure going off by the time i got there. you would have had a great time with us :)

maybe i'll catch you at an outdoor next summer. i don't think i've had the pleasure of stomping around in the dirt with you yet.

Subject: [sfraves] BSP: a slightly more tame halloween option 10.27.07

--0-696652009-1192747696=:1010
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

i'm saying "slightly" more tame because there's still going to be two sound systems, costumed weirdos, and free-flowing brews, but i'm expecting lots of room to move and an atmosphere that allows conversation. 

here's the deal: the folks from the loft/warehouse space where we threw the Want It party asked us to help them throw a little halloween bash. we left a bunch of our sound and deco up and invited some friends, and if you're not feeling the crazy halloween ragers this year you might want to join us. it's a free party, and we're not really going for a packed house. this is basically a homies party, and you're invited.

details are as follows:

      Saturday, October 27th
1300 Potrero presents: Halloween 2007
Featuring DJs from the Ambient Mafia and Want It!
    This Halloween, the 1300 Potrero crew is bringing you an evening of devilish tunes, ghastly wardrobes, and dancing with the undead in an intimate underground setting. Theres no cover so you wont have to sell your soul to have a sinfully good time!
     
Two rooms of music! Photobooth to record your drunken antics!
    
Your turntable tricksters for the evening are:
                          
Gowenauf
dj chai
Dr. Hickory and Mr. Stone
Julio Midnite
Tatar
Actual Rafiq
mo corleone
dj.malloc()
Olde Spooky
Spookeasy Ray

Full holiday garb is more than welcome See you there!
          Halloween 2007
1300 Potrero, San   Francisco, CA
10:00pm  4:00am
21+ w/ID to drink
    Link to flyers: http://flickr.com/photo_zoom.gne?id=1618988997&size=m

On 10/18/07, Ben Haus <benhaus@gmail.com> wrote:
> Doh- the launch?!?!  I know who played it, but I won't say.  I had to ask

> night in big sur in '08-  outside of the rainy season!

> On 10/18/07, mo corleone <mo_corleone2@yahoo.com> wrote:

> > honestly... it was fucking sweet! i wasn't quite sure what to expect, but
> > this party turned out to be the greatest close to the campout season i could
> > have hoped for. the scenery was incredible, my crew got some really reckless
> > mountain biking in, the music was kickass the entire time (except for one
> > set on saturday night - wtf, who still plays "the launch"?!) and it never
> > stopped!
> >
> > maybe i'm getting old, but i'm kind of done with campouts that are
> > basically a bunch of kids on drugs. acid totem's crowd wasn't like that *at
> > all*. it was really refreshing to be around a crowd that was all smiles and
> > super positive without being all "can i give you a hug?" and trying to drink
> > my water ;)
> >
> > seriously, props to acid totem. i'd definitely go to this party again next
> > year. the beauty of the location alone would seal the deal for me, but the
> > rockin' tunes, excellent neighbors, and chilled out vibe make it completely
> > awesome.
> >
> > thanks to all involved for helping me end the campout season on such a
> > high note!

Haha man i miss these osby posts..  Its been forever since i have been here
on SF raves.

On 10/16/07, Osby Oi Oi Jamz <osby@viberation.com> wrote:
>
> So Saturday i was "needed" up in Sac... :code TV was suppose to cover thi=
s
> relaunch/ 3 yr anniversary shindig for LEGENDmag.  So i wnet up there w/
> Roni & KC & oooh shit man... ok.. the spot was this store front building
> on 20th & something & the kinda space there was like for 3 stores w/ no
> walls yet.. so it was huge!!!  Set up was kinda laggin', but no really
> decorations, just a few banners that had some LEGENDmag articles on them.
> But then there was also a redbull/ vodka bar (they were 1 of the
> sponsers), a DJ booth/ dance floor, like 6 or 7 indy clothing vendors, a
> photo area where this photographer dude like took pictures of random
> people, & a make up artist who lol, powdered me when i was sweaty & we ha=
d
>
> to shoot a segment, oh oh oh, & there was this movie Dude who showed his
> films on this projector all night!  The shindig started @ 6, but the
> action didn't start 'til around like 7:30ish...
>
> There's this thing in Downtown SAc called 2nd Saturdays.. it's like this
> mondo party every second Sat of the summer months... so as soon as evenin=
g
> hit.. there were hordes of people walking around to the near by bars &
> clubs... oh yeah.. there was even a DJ spinning outta store in the same
> building on the opposite side of where we were!!
>
> So pretty much there was alot goin' @ the mag shindig... all the clothes =
i
> saw were so damn yummy!!  But hmmm... they wre kinda expensive... oh
> yeah... so like every interview we did, we like totally had to shoot twic=
e
>
> cause the Editor, Rai-mon, wanted to make a show for the website too!  So
> anywaze.. it was kinda funny.. i ended up like interviewing the
> photographer dude & he like like took hella pictures of me during the
> interveiw... it was funny... i mean... & add to that the 2 other phot
> shoots i did with him when before we interviewed him... that was funny!
>
> But yeah.. hella people showed up & I met sooo many Groovy people!!  The
> break dancers were fuckin' ill!  There was this Chic dance group that i
> missed thought :(  I think i was outside takin' a break & cooling out
> ''cause it got totally mondo hot in the party with all them super duper
> power lamps.
>
> All in all.. Hello 2Day, i had such a Groovy Awesome time! It was fuckin'
> So Dope too 'cause i ended up seeing a few Sac homies :)  I wish i coulda
> called more of the Sac Familia.. but i had no #'s :(  Oh oh oh oh ohoh...
> the DJs were dope... the 1st DJ played this old skool hop set, the 2nd DJ
> spun like hella booty retro clubby 80's 90's music & he dropped Ghetto
> Tech!!!  YUM!!  I don't really like remember what the 3rd DJ spun 'cause
> me & Roni wanted to catch more interviews before the party wrapped up...
>
> I'll probably write another post about the mag & tell y'all what it's all
> about... I think the website's up too & link y'all to that :)
>
> Around like 12:30ish...  after everything was cleaned up as much as
> possible & stuff put away, we cut, tired as fuck & kinda burnt from the
> night... I was suppose to go to this surprise birthday party in Berk for
> my Homie Al.. but i was just so like burnt from well.. i didn't get that
> much sleep the night before which i guess added to the hustle & bustle of
> the day...
>
> But after we crossed the Carquinez bridge... lol.. i seriously got like
> this mondo second wind & said fuck it... i need to go to Berk.. so i did
> 'cause i didn't wanna be all guilty for missing my Bro's bday!  OK.. lemm=
e
> just say that 16 hours later... I was @ another house for a mini party,
> then after that.. took BART home ;)  HELLO 2DAY!!!  Yeah.. ok.. partied i=
n
> true Rockstar fashion, got so happy to around mi rave familia, danced,
> laughed, almost played ummmm around, talked, oh oh oh oh, ok so like me &
> this dude who i've always been like on well.. he always hated me fr some
> reason, well, I've always called him Mikey Meanie Gay 'cause he was alway=
s
> like this snob to me when we wre at the same place... but yeah... we
> heeeeeeeeella talked it out & like totally made up & fuck man.. it just
> felt so good to air out that mondo dirty laundry!!  So YAY!!!
>
> Yeah... I left my house @ 2PM Saturday & got home @ 9:30PMish on Sunday!!
> So Dope!!  Hello 2day... it took me all day to get unhungover!!
> --
> Take Care <3
> Peace=3D->Jus' Me =3D-> O=A7bY {8O)

Subject: Re: [sfraves] the best portable DJ "table" solution you've seen

For a really portable setup, the Fingermonsters use heavy-duty keyboard sta=
nds with white-coated MDF sheets on the top.  They work perfectly for live =
PA stuff, and if you got a pretty stout board, it would work quite well for=
 decks and such as well, though you'd probably want to put them and the mix=
er on the board by themselves (sans cases).=0A=0AWhen setting up on a woode=
n stage instead of concrete, nothing really beats cinderblocks + some sort =
of top surface for sound isolation, but of course that's about the heaviest=
 solution and the toughest to set up.  For "big rave" setups I can't really=
 see any kind of stand doing the shock mounting duty blocks can.=0A=0A-G=0A=

Subject: Re: [sfraves] the best portable DJ "table" solution you've seen

At 06:19 PM 10/19/2007, Sarilion wrote:
>cinder blocks O(two separate stacks, alternating pattern) with a 
>heavy, solid piece of wood on it.  many doors are paned or hollow.. 
>but if it's a nice solid one, that can work.


on the lighter (weight-wise) side - -

get a couple of those white and orange signs that they put out for 
street closures -
the ones they use to let you know that you can't park because PG&E is 
doing some work -
super light and they fold up for easy transportation

anyway - line up 2 of those about 3 feet from each other
take the lid from your coffin (do people still use those ?)
place that so that it nests between the highway signs
and place your coffin bottom on top of the coffin top -
ready to go in minutes - especially great for outdoor setups

Subject: Re: [sfraves] the best portable DJ "table" solution you've seen

what brand/model keyboard stands are you guys using?

i'm always worried a keyboard stand won't handle the weight/width of a
mixer, tables and CDJs.


On 10/19/07, georgeC | origami <newstylesound@yahoo.com> wrote:
> For a really portable setup, the Fingermonsters use heavy-duty keyboard stands with white-coated MDF sheets on the top.  They work perfectly for live PA stuff, and if you got a pretty stout board, it would work quite well for decks and such as well, though you'd probably want to put them and the mixer on the board by themselves (sans cases).
>
> When setting up on a wooden stage instead of concrete, nothing really beats cinderblocks + some sort of top surface for sound isolation, but of course that's about the heaviest solution and the toughest to set up.  For "big rave" setups I can't really see any kind of stand doing the shock mounting duty blocks can.
>
> -G

Subject: Re: [sfraves] the best portable DJ "table" solution you've seen

You could do the same thing with saw horses from Home
Depot. They work great and you don't have to steal
them like you would the white and orange street
closure signs lol. The ones I have are even hight and
width adjustable. I don't know if you can still find
the adjustable ones but the regular ones are the right
hight anyways and would work fine. Just put your
coffin right on top of them or use a thick slab of
wood or MDF to put your decks and mixer on and your
set.


--- Jim Cyr <surfpunk@well.com> wrote:

> At 06:19 PM 10/19/2007, Sarilion wrote:
> >cinder blocks O(two separate stacks, alternating
> pattern) with a 
> >heavy, solid piece of wood on it.  many doors are
> paned or hollow.. 
> >but if it's a nice solid one, that can work.
> 
> 
> on the lighter (weight-wise) side - -
> 
> get a couple of those white and orange signs that
> they put out for 
> street closures -
> the ones they use to let you know that you can't
> park because PG&E is 
> doing some work -
> super light and they fold up for easy transportation
> 
> anyway - line up 2 of those about 3 feet from each
> other
> take the lid from your coffin (do people still use
> those ?)
> place that so that it nests between the highway
> signs
> and place your coffin bottom on top of the coffin
> top -
> ready to go in minutes - especially great for
> outdoor setups 
> 
> 
>

At 08:01 AM 10/20/2007, you wrote:
>You could do the same thing with saw horses from Home
>Depot. They work great and you don't have to steal
>them like you would the white and orange street
>closure signs lol. The ones I have are even hight and
>width adjustable. I don't know if you can still find
>the adjustable ones but the regular ones are the right
>hight anyways and would work fine. Just put your
>coffin right on top of them or use a thick slab of
>wood or MDF to put your decks and mixer on and your
>set.
>
>
>--- Jim Cyr <surfpunk@well.com> wrote:
>
> > At 06:19 PM 10/19/2007, Sarilion wrote:
> > >cinder blocks O(two separate stacks, alternating
> > pattern) with a
> > >heavy, solid piece of wood on it.  many doors are
> > paned or hollow..
> > >but if it's a nice solid one, that can work.
> >
> >
> > on the lighter (weight-wise) side - -
> >
> > get a couple of those white and orange signs that
> > they put out for
> > street closures -
> > the ones they use to let you know that you can't
> > park because PG&E is
> > doing some work -
> > super light and they fold up for easy transportation
> >
> > anyway - line up 2 of those about 3 feet from each
> > other
> > take the lid from your coffin (do people still use
> > those ?)
> > place that so that it nests between the highway
> > signs
> > and place your coffin bottom on top of the coffin
> > top -
> > ready to go in minutes - especially great for
> > outdoor setups
> >
> >

> Depot. They work great and you don't have to steal
> them like you would the white and orange street
> closure signs lol. The ones I have are even hight and
> width adjustable. I don't know if you can still find
> the adjustable ones but the regular ones are the right
> hight anyways and would work fine. Just put your
> coffin right on top of them or use a thick slab of
> wood or MDF to put your decks and mixer on and your
> set.

> --- Jim Cyr <surfpunk@well.com> wrote:
>
> > At 06:19 PM 10/19/2007, Sarilion wrote:
> > >cinder blocks O(two separate stacks, alternating

> > >heavy, solid piece of wood on it.  many doors are

> >

> > they put out for
> > street closures -
> > the ones they use to let you know that you can't
> > park because PG&E is
> > doing some work -
> > super light and they fold up for easy transportation

Subject: [sfraves] TheDJList.com spams

Just got my 1st spam (or at least the 1st one that I noticed) to a 
unique/non-dictionary email address that shows that thedjlist.com either 
sold or traded email addresses.  (Looking further it looks like they may 
have sold/traded it to a performer for a Ruby Skye appearance back in 
July.)

Just an FYI for folks out there.

I almost 100% of the time these days use a unique address for each 
website I register with (and ONLY expose it to them in their 
registration page.)  Thus I can be certain when this sort of thing 
happens.

Andy & Friends, movementnow.org, Left Coast Techno and nvraves.com =
present: Nowloween III
Saturday October 27th, 2007
Reno's premiere Halloween event!

-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=
=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-

<<<<The Torture Chamber: Techno / Trance / Electro>>>>

++COMMANDER TOM++
(Noom, Ministry Sound, Eternal Tour, commander-tom.com - Germany)
Well unless you've been living in a cave the last 10 years the name =
Commander Tom shouldn't need any introduction. Tom has been DJing and =
creating music for the last 25 years. He has played at almost all the =
big raves around, including Energy 92-96, Tribal Gathering, Omni 93, =
Rave City 3 and 4, Union Move, Time Tunnel, and the infamous Love =
Parades in Berlin. Throughout the mid to late 90's when trance and =
techno were growing continually farther apart, tom helped define the =
murky area between the two, a unique sound he trademarked his own.

The cult began in spring 1994 when "Are Am Eye" was released as #13 on =
NOOM. This record sold more than 100,000 copies worldwide on vinyl =
format only and it grew up to be the club anthem of the 90's. Today this =
classic is still a basic part of DJ-sets all over the world. Tom has =
produced a lot of remixes for artists such as Baby Doc, Chris Liberator, =
Tesox, Jon the Dentist, DJ Sammy, and many more. Commander Tom is now =
one of the world's most extensively toured DJs, spreading his unique =
sound as far and wide as possible.

++ANT ++
(Powertools / Stay Up Forever - U.K.)
ANT is one of the primary DJ's and producers for the Stay Up Forever =
Collective, London, and owner of Powertools Records, one of the many, =
successful, hard-hitting labels put out through the S.U.F. camp. He has =
been DJing nationally and internationally since 1994 and leaving his =
mark on vinyl since 1997. London's infamous free party scene played host =
to ANT's first DJ experiences and over the pursuing decade, he continued =
making a name for himself DJing throughout the U.K. as well as in =
countries such as Brazil, Venezuela, South Africa, Poland, Bulgaria, =
Sardinia, Ireland, Holland, France, U.S.A., Canada, Czech Republic, =
Russia, Spain, Israel and Japan. From the knowledge gained as the =
in-house engineer for Kinetec Studios for over 4 years, he advanced his =
producing career and honed his sound further by starting Powertools =
Records, as well as creating The Power Plant, the studio in which he =
writes his music today. ANT's studio and productions have played host to =
a variety of like-minded people right through from techno and hardcore's =
Lenny Dee to hard-dance's Andy Farley, not forgetting to mention all the =
regular London techno team-mates, namely the Liberators, D.A.V.E. The =
Drummer and Geezer. Ant has also worked on projects outside of the =
techno spectrum, creating music for video and TV for the likes of MTV =
Europe and Sony, as well as recording under pseudonyms such as the dance =
chart-topping, "Stratosphere".

++Circuit Breaker & Eric Ryan++ (Hard To Swallow, Storm Rave, Eternal =
Tour - Philidelphia, PA) / (Hard To Swallow, Eternal Tour - Los Angeles, =
CA)
++Serch ++(Freshout, theserch.com - Chicago)
++G.A.M.M.A. & Andy++ (Stilldream, Left Coast Techno) / (Andy & Friends)
++RDG & Analog Jack++  (Mossberg 12's)
++Dirt++ (Omniscient Records - San Francisco)
++Andres Amezcua++ (myspace.com/andresamezcua - San Francisco)

-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=
=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-

*****Celebrating the release of Left Coast Techno #01*****
"Blackhole Burnout" by G.A.M.M.A. and Phokus with remixes by: Aaron =
Liberator & The Geezer, and David Aaron & Psylence.
Buy it at the show - Don't miss out on this long awaited release!

-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=
=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-

<<<<The Bog Of Eternal Beats: House / Breaks / Nu Skool>>>>

++LEE COOMBS++ (Thrust Recordings, leecoombs.co.uk - U.K.)

>From the start of his DJ career in 1986, Lee Coombs submerged himself in =
the acid house scene in and around the UK. In June 2001 came the release =
of Lee's seminal "Future Sound of Retro" album on Finger Lickin' which =
prompted dance giants Seb Fontaine & Pete Tong to label Coombs as the =
"Man To Watch." Soon artists such as New Order, Lamb, and Moby were =
calling about his remixing talents.
   =20
After long consideration he decided to split from Finger Lickin' Records =
and concentrate on putting music out on his own label, Thrust =
Recordings, along with releases planned for Adrift Records and Meat =
Katies own Lot49 imprint. His celebrated DJ sets & tracks are in an =
interwoven blend of acid undertones accompanied by modern breaks with =
deep influences of electro, house, and treacherous techno. With Lee's =
feverish remix schedule and his tireless global touring, the world has =
taken notice of his extraordinary talent.

++DJ Kling++ (ravefix.com, Planet X - New York, NY)
++Lyfe++ (Slipmat Science - Bend, OR)
++David Aaron & Rizin++ (Stilldream, Movementnow.org) / (Stilldream)
++Phokus++ (Ritual Sounds, Movementnow.org)
++Savage Patch Kids++ (Featuring Nick Nyquil, Adam Ant, & Andy P) SAC/SF =
(Connected) / (Love Allstars) / (Nocturnalism)
++Atom One & Gyver++ (National Entity, Channelz) / (Channelz)
++Deviant++ (Foreign Blend)
++DJ Daniel++ (Andy & Friends)

-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=
=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-

<<<<The Lost Dungeon: Dub Step / Psy Breaks / Mid Tempo / Trip Hop>>>>

++Seventh Swami++ (LIVE PA) (Ambient Mafia, Escape Artists - Sacramento)
++Mr. Rogers++ (Ooze System, Full Melt - San Francisco)
++Tha Fruitbat++ (LIVE PA) (Lunatic Works, Synthetic - Sacramento)
++Genji++ (Word of Mouth - San Francisco)
++Sereoja++ (KGBeats - San Francisco)
++Resynthesize++ (Escape Artists - Sacramento)
++Rhedcerulean++ (Escape Artists - Sacramento)

-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=
=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D-

NOWLOWEEN 07:
It's that time of the year again where the eerie, kooky, happy vibe of =
Halloween surrounds and envelopes us. Let us all embrace it with a night =
filled with mind blowing music, amazing people and a vibe so thick you =
could cut it with a knife.

FEATURING:
- THIS YEARS EVENT WILL FEATURE THE BEST IN INTERNATIONAL, NATIONAL AND =
LOCAL TALENT!
- EAR SHREADING SOUND BY: LITE BRITE PRODUCTIONS
- EYE MELTING LASERS BY: UV99
- 9 HOURS OF MUSICAL MADNESS!
- TECHNO AND INTELLI BEAMS BY: LITE BRITE PRODUCTIONS
- VISUALS BY: LITE BRITE PRODUCTIONS
- FREE GRAB BAGS FOR THE FIRST 250 PEOPLE INCLUDING GLOWSTICKS, CDS AND =
MORE!
- GIVEAWAYS ALL NIGHT LONG!
- OVER 25 DJS AND LIVE ACTS!
- A SPOOKY, CREAPY DON'T GET LOST IN YOU MIGHT NOT COME OUT HAUNTED =
HOUSE!

DONATIONS:
Last year we raised over 1,000 pounds of canned food for the Food Bank =
of Northern Nevada. Lets get together and smash that record. In keeping =
with tradition we will be donating a dollar for every pound of canned =
food received to the Washoe Medical Cancer Research. Together we can =
make a difference!

7PM - 4AM
FOR MORE INFO:
www.movementnow.org / www.aafevents.com / www.nvraves.com
775.473.1198 / 916.484.3717



Paul Plescov

Subject: [sfraves] BSP - ambient mafia 8-year secret headliner: revealed!

San Francisco's Ambient Mafia has been skullfucking the chill
room for eight years, and now it's time to celebrate with a
party you'll either never forget or wish you could remember.

The Ambient Mafia 8-Year Anniversary with DJ Garth

Who: The Ambient Mafia w/DJ Garth (Back2Back, Grayhound, Golden
Goose)
When: Saturday, 11.10.07
Time: 9pm-6am
Where: Virgin UG Venue (TBA)
Presales: www.ambientmafia.com

We're proud to announce our first Special Guest Headliner ever
for a Mafia event ... SF's legendary Garth will be pulling
rarities from his crates for a special exclusive downtempo set!
Be there for a set you won't hear anywhere else!

Your favorite Mafia DJs will be on hand, of course, workin' it
out in two rooms of beats and ambience.

Get your presale tickets at www.ambientmafia.com now! And while
you're there, check out our new storefront featuring loads of
great Ambient Mafia schwag like shirts and hoodies, all
emblazoned with our classic "Godfather" logo (and more original
designs on the way). You've asked for it for years, and now's
your chance to get cool Mafia gear on demand!

more fun, since I don't have the spider, they can't

thinks, I might be having a nice size chunk of leg
removed to keep the poison from killing the rest of

Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: You know what isn't fun?

Just got back....

No cutting yet. As of now, they put me on heavy duty
steroids and a month of augmenton (sp?) ... with
strict instructions thhat if the basbeall sized hard
lump of ooze and dead/dying tissue grows, to
immediately go back to the emergency room.

Apparently, the toxin continues to kill tissue for a
week or two after the bite... So I am in wait and see
mode for the time being.... at least the antibiotics
will keep me from getting blood poisoning or somthing
to that affect.  Had I cought the spider they would
have given me anti-venom, but since they can only
guess at what it is, they are doing all they can.
Toxicology on it would take longer to figure out than
the time to administer anti-venom is possible

Interestingly, it doesn't really hurt  that bad. I
felt no bite at all. Didn't sting or anything...
although, it looks pretty fucking gross... like a
baseball with a volcano on top. ;)

Peas.

E

immediately go back to the emergency room.

Apparently, the toxin continues to kill tissue for a
week or two after the bite... So I am in wait and see
mode for the time being.... at least the antibiotics
will keep me from getting blood poisoning or somthing
to that affect. Had I cought the spider they would
have given me anti-venom, but since they can only
guess at what it is, they are doing all they can.
Toxicology on it would take longer to figure out than
the time to administer anti-venom is possible

Interestingly, it doesn't really hurt that bad. I
felt no bite at all. Didn't sting or anything...
although, it looks pretty fucking gross... like a
baseball with a volcano on top. ;)

Peas.

E

Subject: [sfraves] [BSP] Friday :: Filter.SF :: B U T A N E [3 hr dj set] + k o n t a k t [live PA premier]

------=_Part_7825_14645412.1193251444059
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Content-Disposition: inline

*friday: oct 26::07*

Filter.SF presents::* B U T A N E* :: 3 Hr DJ set

plus

*k o n t a k t* :: live pa premier

anu-bar
46 sixth street, S.F

$5 before 10:30
$10 after 10:30

////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

10:00 PM - 11:00 PM
Kontakt [Filter.SF/BABD] - live pa

11:00 PM - 2:00 am

Butane [Alphahouse/berlin] 3 hour dj set


///////////////////////////////////////////

*About Butane, aka Andrew Rasse [Alphahouse/Berlin/St. Louis]:*

Having relocated from St. Louis to Berlin, Alphahouse label boss and
partymaker Butane has managed to solidify his already infamous reputation as
a captivating performer whose success rests on his own merits.

Because he knows well that "minimal" is merely a philosophy to be applied,
rather than a narrow range of sounds, Butane is so high in demand as both a
producer as well as a DJ.

His tracks have been featured on Matthew Dear's Fabric compilation as well
as Luciano's HiFi SciFi, plus labels Dumb Unit, Num and Ryrgular.

Narcotic killers like "On the Ket" and catalog of remixes and co-productions
have set him apart from the crowd as a true master of dark and twisted
dancefloor kemistry.

*Check out video of these performances from this past year's DEMF:*

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1vtRywqh4KY
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=giqa-fJzX-U

*Info:
*www.myspace.com/butane_alphahouse



*About Kontakt [aka Yanni Ehm, co-founder of Bay Area Beatdrop and Filter.SF
]:*

Growing up on post-punk rock and the early analog techno sounds of Joy
Division, Filter founder Kontakt shunned the decade of disco + house music,
gravitating instead to ambient, IDM + trip-hop, and finally working toward
his own digital production.

Kontakt's Live PA is a minimal progression toward maximized-hypno techno
with touches of filtered mono-bass, tones on tails, reverb pongo-dial
overlays, texturized attacks and congo-enhanced swing beats.

*Info:
*www.myspace.com/solekandi

------=_Part_7825_14645412.1193251444059--

streamed on my musicv2 page located at:

http://www.stickam.com/profile/djkevinjames

1620Le and a Thrive Audio tube isolator. Its not
perfect by any means, but overall I'm happy with how
it turned out and hey, it's a live mix anyways so fuck
it. Comments and feedback are welcome whether you love
it or even if you think its the worst piece of shit
you've ever heard lol
